subsection.heading: Federal Charter.—
subsection.content: Theodore Roosevelt Association (in this chapter, the “corporation”) is a body corporate and politic in the District of Columbia.

subsection.heading: Perpetual Existence.—
subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided, the corporation has perpetual existence.

section.heading: Purposes
section.chapeau: The purposes of the corporation are—

paragraph.content: to perpetuate the memory of Theodore Roosevelt for the benefit of the people of the United States and the world; and

paragraph.chapeau: to solicit, receive, hold, and maintain funds, and to apply the principal of the funds and the income from those funds to the following objects, among others:

subparagraph.content: the erection and maintenance of a suitable and adequate monumental memorial in the District of Columbia to the memory of Theodore Roosevelt;
the acquisition, development, and maintenance of a public park in memory of Theodore Roosevelt in Oyster Bay, New York;
the establishment and maintenance of an endowment fund to promote the development and application of the policies and ideals of Theodore Roosevelt for the benefit of the American people; and

the donation of real and personal property, including part or all of its endowment fund, to a public agency for the purpose of preserving in public ownership historically significant property associated with the life of Theodore Roosevelt.

content.p: Eligibility for membership in the corporation is as provided in regulations adopted by the board of trustees.

subsection.heading: Board of Trustees.—
subsection.content: A self-perpetuating board of trustees shall manage and direct the property and affairs of the corporation.

subsection.heading: Powers.—
subsection.chapeau: The board of trustees may adopt and amend a constitution, bylaws, and regulations for—

paragraph.content: the conduct of the affairs of the corporation.
adopt a constitution, bylaws, and regulations;
adopt and alter a corporate seal;
acquire and own property necessary to carry out the purposes of the corporation;
give and dedicate its property to public agencies and purposes;
maintain offices, hold meetings, and conduct business affairs in the District of Columbia and in the States, territories, and possessions of the United States;
sue and be sued within the jurisdiction of the United States; and
do any other act necessary and proper to carry out the purposes of the corporation.

subsection.heading: Exclusively Educational Purposes.—
subsection.content: The corporation shall be operated exclusively for educational purposes.

subsection.heading: Stocks and Dividends.—
subsection.content: The corporation may not issue stock or declare or pay a dividend.

subsection.heading: Distributions of Income or Assets.—
subsection.content: The income or assets of the corporation may not inure to the benefit of any member or individual.

content.p: The audit requirements of section 10101 of this title do not apply to the corporation.
